subhead: The vote to nationalize ArcelorMittal France passed in the Assemblée Nationale on Thursday, but it is likely to rejected by the Sénat.

subhead: In recent weeks, Algiers has made numerous gestures of goodwill toward the Trump administration, hoping to break out of its regional isolation.

title: Mexico's new Frida Kahlo museum bends the truth
subhead: Since opening to the public this fall in Mexico City, a new museum devoted to painter Frida Kahlo has sparked a series of controversies. Contrary to claims by its owners, the house was never the home of the Kahlo family, and a mural discovered on site was likely not the artist's creation.

subhead: The plan agreed upon by coalition members is to maintain pension levels despite the aging population. But it is opposed by young conservatives, who are calling for more sweeping reforms.

title: Leo XIV to visit Turkey and Lebanon on his first papal trip
subhead: On his debut on the international stage, the head of the Catholic Church will celebrate the 1,700th anniversary of the Council of Nicaea on Lake Iznik, at the invitation of the patriarch of Constantinople. The stop in Lebanon gives him the opportunity to send a message to a region in crisis.

title: Why our old clothes end up in the UAE
subhead: The country has emerged as a leader in sorting secondhand clothing, taking advantage of Europe's inability to process its own stockpiles. This outsourcing comes with clear environmental and social costs.
